column1: What did the necktie say to the hat? you go on ahead, ill just hang around.
column3: Hang can refer to a physical action of suspending something and an informal way of passing time idly.
column4: The picture frame will hang on the wall for everyone to see.
column5: I like to hang with my friends on the weekends.

column1: Whats the hardest thing about becoming a lawyer in ireland? passing the bar.
column3: Bar refers to the legal profession (the qualification to practice law) and a physical establishment where drinks are served.
column4: After years of study, she was finally able to pass the bar exam.
column5: We decided to meet at the bar for drinks after work.

column1: What did the egg say at the party? omelet.
column3: Omelet can refer to the dish made from beaten eggs and can be used as a pun for I’m-a-let as someone who wants to join in.
column4: I enjoy making a delicious omelet filled with vegetables for breakfast.
column5: When you’re invited to any gathering, just remember to omelet (I’m-a-let) yourself have fun.
